data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face your forward direction you can go forward. The instructions say always facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around: Take 4 steps and turn around. Turn around: Take 4 steps and turn around. Take right: Turn right. Thus, the answer is No.

When you are taking 4 steps, you need to take 10 steps. Take 4 steps when you're looking at the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

To turn left, you take 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

You are repositioning a person by returning them to the original position. There are no directions indicating the return is a left. You turn around, then make 7 steps back to turn around. So, the answer is No.

Just because you take 8 steps and take 9 steps does not mean you return to the starting point. So, the answer is it is not possible to tell.

Reversing one of the steps always returns you to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

You take 5 steps on each side of the staircase. The first 3 steps you took are at the top of the stairs. One of the first steps is taken back to the top of the stairs. The second step is taken at the back of the stairs. The third step is taken at the top of the stairs. Therefore, the answer is No.

The first instruction is to never Face forward. To take one step backward, you have to take no more than three steps. The second instruction is to always Face forward and to take one step backward. So, the answer is no.

Take 6 steps left and the last step is backwards. Take 8 steps right and the last step is backwards. Take 5 steps left and the last step is left. In order to complete the entire sequence, you would need to take all of the steps left and return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Right: 3 steps forward. Left: 3 steps left. Left: 1 step left. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you take 10 steps backward. If you always face left, you take 7 steps left. If you always face right, you take 8 steps right. If you always face left, you take 4 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

First one is facing forward and taking 5 steps right. Once that is done, one takes 4 steps backward and 2 steps left. Next one is facing forward and taking 5 steps left. Once that is done, one takes 4 steps backward and 2 steps right. Finally, a single person can take 4 steps backward and 2 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are taking 6 steps right and it takes you to the starting point, this implies you are facing forward. The starting point is facing in the direction you always take 6 steps right. If you are taking 4 steps right and it takes you to the starting point, this implies you are facing the wrong way. The beginning point is facing in the direction you always take 4 steps. If you are taking 2 steps forward and it takes you to the starting point, this implies that you are facing the right. This statement does not imply that you are facing the direction you always take 2 steps forward. If you are taking 9 steps forward and it takes you to the starting point, this implies that you are facing the right direction. The starting point is facing in the direction of your highest left. Because you normally take 2 steps forward before you take 9 steps forward, this means that you take 2 steps right before you take 9 steps forward. To take 9 steps forward, you should always be facing the left side of your body. To take 3 steps right before taking 9 steps forward, you should always be facing the right side of your body. Thus, the answer is No.

There is no way to go back to the starting point with all the steps. So, the answer is yes.

Forward facing is always a forward step. A backward step is a step backward. Backward step: 7 steps backward. Forward step: four steps forward. Left step: left step. So, the answer is Yes.
